intro: Psychotria coaetanea, commonly known as the "coca plant" or "Yareta," is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the Andean regions of South America, particularly in countries like Bolivia, Peru, and Ecuador. The plant is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and small, white or pinkish flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in high-altitude environments, often growing in rocky or mountainous terrain. Due to its ecological importance and traditional uses, it is also of interest in botanical and ethnobotanical studies.
